newsitem.title: UK: Barclays to launch PC banking service in UK.
newsitem.headline: Barclays to launch PC banking service in UK.

text.p: British banking giant Barclays Plc said on Monday it planned to launch a personal computer banking service in the UK via Microsoft Corp software in the spring of 1997.
Barclays said the service would allow customers to pay bills, download up-to-date banking transaction details and display account history using graphics, among other things.
Microsoft's personal finance software, Microsoft Money '97, will be available in UK shops from mid-November, priced at 27.0 stg plus value-added tax (VAT), the bank said in a statement.
In the spring of this year, Barclays launched a PC banking pilot including more than 2,500 customers in the UK.
